name: Betla National Park
description: A national park in Jharkhand, India, known for its diverse wildlife.

name: Dassam Falls
description: A picturesque waterfall near Ranchi, where the Kanchi River cascades.

name: Hundru Falls
description: One of the highest waterfalls in Jharkhand, created on the Subarnarekha River.

name: Netarhat
description: A hill station known as the 'Queen of Chotanagpur' for its scenic beauty.

name: Parasnath Hill
description: The highest mountain in Jharkhand, a significant pilgrimage site for Jains.

name: Baidyanath Temple
description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, a revered Hindu temple complex in Deoghar.

name: Jagannath Temple, Ranchi
description: A 17th-century temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath, located in Ranchi.

name: Rajrappa Temple
description: A famous Hindu pilgrimage site known for the Chinnamasta Temple.

name: Tagore Hill
description: A serene hill in Ranchi, associated with Rabindranath Tagore.

name: Jonha Falls
description: Also known as Gautamdhara, a beautiful waterfall near Ranchi.

name: Hirni Falls
description: A scenic waterfall located in a dense forest area of West Singhbhum.

name: Dalma Wildlife Sanctuary
description: Home to elephants, deer, and other wildlife, located near Jamshedpur.

name: Ghatshila
description: A town known for its natural beauty, forests, and the Subarnarekha River.

name: Jubilee Park, Jamshedpur
description: A large urban park in Jamshedpur, often called the 'Lungs of the City'.

name: Dimna Lake
description: An artificial reservoir near Jamshedpur, popular for boating and picnics.

name: Kanke Dam
description: A dam and reservoir in Ranchi, offering scenic views and recreational activities.

name: Rock Garden, Ranchi
description: A unique garden built from the rocks of Gonda Hill, featuring sculptures.

name: Patratu Valley
description: A scenic valley with winding roads and lush greenery, popular for drives.

name: McCluskieganj
description: A quaint Anglo-Indian village known for its colonial bungalows.

name: Lodh Falls
description: The highest waterfall in Jharkhand, also known as Burhagagh Falls.
